commitResults.messageTitle: Added ability to add and list
Add the ability to mark tasks as done and change it back to undone
Updated Task class, added DeadlineTask, EventTask, ToDoTask classes
Add support for tracking three types of tasks: ToDos, Deadlines and Events
Created classes for exceptions regarding the creation of the different task types
Added support for catching when index is out of range
Added support for deleting tasks from the list.
Add method to format tasks to write to file
commitResults.messageBody:
The different task classes did not support returning a String suitable for writing to a file to support data storage.

Fixing this will allow us to write to a file to support storage.

We add the required constructors that enable setting of boolean isDone and method toFileFormat()

commitResults.messageTitle: Support reading from and writing to file
commitResults.messageBody:
Elara did not support reading to and writing from file, so user has to
retype todo list every time Elara is run

Restructuring Elara by adding methods to read files, parse files for
tasks and save tasks to file allows us to store the data in a specified
file.

Let's reorganise code for Elara by breaking up into smaller blocks
and add methods readFile(), setupFile(), parseTask() and
saveTasksToFile().

commitResults.messageTitle: Update DeadlineTaskException and EventException error message
commitResults.messageBody:
Previous error message did not specify format for deadline and start and end
time for deadline and event tasks.

Updating the error messages allows users to know the proper format to send into
Elara such that they can efficiently use the task list.

Let's update the error message to include the format to parse for LocalDateTime

commitResults.messageTitle: Change format for deadlines and event start and end to LocalDateTime
commitResults.messageBody:
The previous type for storing deadlines and event timings was String, which
does not allow for more meaningful storage.

Changing the type to LocalDateTime allows the chatbot to understand that
it is a date and time instead of just a String.

Let's edit the DeadlineTask and EventTask variables to reflect this, as well
as change the format of parseTask() to support reading such data from files.
